overview_summary: All five neighbors have no documented stance on the proposed development; none has openly supported or opposed it. They also do not hold prominent roles in local affairs, with all generally regarded as private residents of low community influence.

neighbors.name: Frank C. Pegues & Tina M. Pegues
neighbors.claims: Frank C. Pegues and Tina M. Pegues are local residents in Jefferson County, WV, with no public record of involvement in community planning or development debates [Change.org Petition](https://www.change.org/p/local-residents-high-density-development-zoning). They are not listed among prominent farmland preservation participants or civic petitioners in the area [Jefferson County Farmland Protection](https://wvfp.org/jefferson/three-farms-join-the-jefferson-county-farmland-protection-program/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a personal, neighborly approach via a trusted local intermediary. Emphasize listening to any concerns about property or lifestyle impacts and provide fact-based reassurances.

neighbors.name: Joseph P. Johnson
neighbors.claims: Joseph P. Johnson owns property in the vicinity but has maintained a low public profile regarding development issues [Change.org Petition](https://www.change.org/p/local-residents-high-density-development-zoning). No news reports or community records indicate any stance or activism by Johnson on local land-use proposals [Jefferson County Farmland Protection](https://wvfp.org/jefferson/three-farms-join-the-jefferson-county-farmland-protection-program/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate a polite, informal conversation (door-to-door or at a community meeting) to introduce the project. Allow Johnson to voice any questions, and share information on how local property values and community character will be protected.

neighbors.name: Calvin L. Togans & Cynthia C. Togans
neighbors.claims: Calvin L. Togans and Cynthia C. Togans are property owners in Jefferson County who have not publicly weighed in on development plans [Jefferson County Farmland Protection](https://wvfp.org/jefferson/three-farms-join-the-jefferson-county-farmland-protection-program/). Their names do not appear in recent community petitions or farmland preservation rosters, suggesting no active role in local land-use debates [Change.org Petition](https://www.change.org/p/local-residents-high-density-development-zoning).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via a friendly in-person visit by a community liaison or neighbor. Emphasize respect for local traditions and answer any questions about how the project will address traffic, noise, and other quality-of-life concerns.

neighbors.name: George E. Newman Jr. & Joyce A. Newman
neighbors.claims: George E. Newman Jr. was a U.S. Army veteran who served during the Vietnam War era [VA Memorial](https://www.vlm.cem.va.gov/GEORGEENEWMANJR/a583ab). He and his wife, Joyce A. Newman (68), relocated from Northern Virginia to a home in Charles Town by 2012 [Public Records Database](https://besthistorysites.net/name/joyce-newman/4) ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/joyce-newman/4#:~:text=1573%20Tuscaville%20Rd%2C%20Charles%20Town%2C,2018)). The Newmans have not made any known public comments on local development proposals and are not identified with any organized support or opposition in the community [Change.org Petition](https://www.change.org/p/local-residents-high-density-development-zoning).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected community member (or fellow veteran) reach out to thank Mr. Newman for his service and discuss the project informally. Building rapport on common ground and clearly explaining plans can encourage the Newmans’ openness.

neighbors.name: Donald K. Mickey & Gail H. Mickey
neighbors.claims: Donald K. Mickey and Gail H. Mickey are local landowners identified near the project site, without any recorded public statements for or against the development [Change.org Petition](https://www.change.org/p/local-residents-high-density-development-zoning). They have not appeared in county farmland program records or other land-use advocacy efforts, indicating no notable public stance on growth issues [Jefferson County Farmland Protection](https://wvfp.org/jefferson/three-farms-join-the-jefferson-county-farmland-protection-program/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Mickeys through a neighborly introduction, perhaps via a mutual acquaintance or local community gathering. Emphasize transparency about the project timeline and assurances regarding maintenance of local roadways, scenery, and quiet.
